intro: Galactia rugosa subf. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compound leaves with broad, ovate leaflets and clusters of small, pea-like flowers that range from white to pale pink. The plant produces leguminous pods that contain several elliptical seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. The species is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient component of desert ecosystems.
